Articles.Content:
Hey Guys,

Been playing Kerbal for a few months now and I have decided that I simply suck as a rocket designer!

In order to improve, tomorrow (starting 2pm GMT) I will be taking part in a 24 hour charity gaming marathon in which I will dedicate much of my time to this delightful game. As a personal challenge, I aim to take 3 willing victims/volunteers to all (land-able) celestial bodies in the Kerbal-verse.

Thus far in my experience, I have managed to get a load of kerbals on the moon, but not get them back, so as you can see, I am going to struggle here!

The only mods I will be using is MechJeb (to save some time and make it a bit easier) and possibly procedural fairings because I like the look.

So fellow rocket scientists - any tips?

Cheers guys!

If you want to donate, the charity we are playing for is the "Sick Kids Friends Foundation" which supports the Edinburgh Sick Children's Hospital. You can donate here: http://www.justgiving.com/SKSP2013
Good luck! Might be a good idea to link the stream will certainly watch when I have the time

Sorry forgot to mention I will be streaming on Twitch should my terrible connection allow!

http://www.twitch.tv/ham1989

Good luck on improving your designing! If you link the stream, I'l watch! [if I have the time, Which I will]

My tip for you, Recreating anything but the space shuttle or Buran works pretty well! I base alot of my designs off the Delta IV heavy and it works a treat!

Practice with Mun runs. If you can master landing on and returning from that, then a lot of other planets and moons will be easier once you understand the basics.

I'd also suggest you avoid landing on Eve and Tylo, at least until you have more experience.

Planets/moons I'd suggest for landing and returning from are: Mun, Minmus, Duna, Ike, Vall, Pol and Bop.

Try Dres , Moho and Eeloo if you do ok at those and feel confident..

I'll be watching. not right from the start, but most of it.

Will it have commentary?

Ill do as much talking as I can.

We have some other challenges from other games so I don't know how the 24hrs will pan out - I personally want to do what I can on Kerbal but if I am hitting a wall, who knows. I will see what I can do.

My initial challenge is to get the Mun and Minmus out of the way, followed by Duna. Just see how things progress.
I'm going to post a blog post about it, thanks for doing this!
Thats awesome but dont put too much pressure on lol!
Been messing about tonight and managed to get a nice design together for a cluster engine. Test tomorrow!
Good luck! I'm thinking of doing some streaming of KSP next month as part of Desert Bus for Hope (http://desertbus.org/), so let me know how your streaming goes!

Quick update:

Just trying to visit what I can, returns are proving difficult for some of the more dense planets and time is a factor.

Have visited the Mun and Minmus so far!

Offline?

Why is there a ten-character requirement it makes no sense fgsdfs
Yeah one of the other team is having a few games of LoL
Yeah sorry its been on and off depending on who is doing what at the time. There are 3 of us, Im the only one playing kerbal.
